Description: Sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery oinochoe consisting of lip, rotelle, and neck; white slip; inside steakily glazed; outside, part of spiralling tendril on neck, triple circle and dot frieze on rotelle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Copenhagen 5607 in Cook and Dupont, 1998, p. 55, fig. 8.20. See also Rhodes 11544 in CVA, Rodi, Museo Archeologico Dello Spedale Dei Cavalieri 2, II.D.H.1, PL.(475) 7.1 See also Bristol H2016.e
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.623)
